channel.title: Help with Perfect ring and skull for pk areas
channel.description:
If you could make tuts that would be great because I suck at codeing, just tell me what to put (exactly) and where.
Here's the more important thing I need. I need to make it where perfect rings are admin and owner only. I need to make it where it automatically deletes the ring if anybody else has it. If you could do that would be really cool, thanks. All I need is the codeing for it and where to put it.
I would like to make it so that the skull appears everywhere you pk because my server is a pk server but the skull isn't there everywhere you pk, please tell me the codeing so I can add it and under the skull I would like it to say PK AREA, thanks.

item.title: Help with Perfect ring and skull for pk areas
item.dc:creator: @Nintendo_G Nintendo_G
item.description:
@Nintendo_G wrote:

[quote=“Xbox Modder, post:29, topic:84391”]Add it above

public int GetCLStrength(int ItemID) {

Maybe that’ll work…

Make sure it’s after the brackets but before

public int GetCLStrength(int ItemID) {[/quote]
Since you didn’t tell me earlier it’s all messed up from me trying I get 100 errors everytime and I accidnetally saved it and I don’t know what to do cries what am I supposed to do!?

Read full topic

item.description:

Yeah… That’s more logical… I can find a tutorial if you still need one…
[/quote]
no I just need to know where to add that after?[br][size=1]Posted on: April 24, 2007, 03:21:41 PM[/size][hr][quote author=n0vamage link=topic=123932.msg1212079#msg1212079 date=1177467656]

He’s got a point.

on my server I made perfect rings have insane bonuses I think it’s like a 10,000 bonus on everything

not to be mean or anything but didnt it come with that?.. but again you could just remove it all :l
[/quote]
that’s what I thought, until he said that so I just assumed he was right.[br][size=1]Posted on: April 24, 2007, 03:23:27 PM[/size][hr]do I add it under
public boolean process?[/quote]

Dont Triple Post

Read full topic

search public void or public boolean now?

item.title: Help with Perfect ring and skull for pk areas
item.dc:creator: @Nintendo_G Nintendo_G
item.description:
@Nintendo_G wrote:

Yes but what I’m saying is when I tryed to add it under that in the client folder and compiled it I got 100 errors then when I took it out no errors please tell me more specifically where I should put it so I don’t get 100 errors (really I got exactly that many)[br][size=1]Posted on: April 24, 2007, 03:43:17 PM[/size][hr]This is what I see

public boolean process() {		// is being called regularily every 500ms
		writePlayers(); 
		if (actionAmount < 0) {
			actionAmount = 0;
		}
		if (actionTimer > 0) {
			actionTimer -= 1;
		}
		if (actionAmount > 25) {
			sendMessage("Kicked for acting too fast!");
			misc.println("Client acts too fast - disconnecting it");
			disconnected = true;
		}
		if (theifTimer > 0) {
			theifTimer -= 1;
		}
		if (AgilityTimer > 0) {
			AgilityTimer -= 1;
		}
		if (WCTimer > 0) {
			WCTimer -= 1;
		}
		if (RCTimer > 0) {
			RCTimer -= 1;
		}
		if (healTimer > 0) {
			healTimer -= 1;

Where EXACTLY do I put the code so I don’t get a bunch of errors.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Perfect ring and skull for pk areas
item.dc:creator: @I_Br3ndan_I I Br3ndan I
item.description:
@I_Br3ndan_I wrote:

If you wan’t to make the ‘P’ ring shit, just search 'perfect'_ring in item.cfg and you should see something like this

item = 773	'perfect'_ring	A_perfect_ruby_ring.	1469.99280576915	1469.99280576915	1760.58823743125	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000	10000

Replace with this item = 773 'perfect'_ring A_perfect_ruby_ring. 1469.99280576915 1469.99280576915 1760.58823743125 10 10 10 10 10 10 10 10 10 10 10 10

Read full topic

item.title: Help with Perfect ring and skull for pk areas
item.dc:creator: @Nintendo_G Nintendo_G
item.description:
@Nintendo_G wrote:

[quote=“Slivion, post:2, topic:84391”]Perfect ring.

if (ItemID == 773) && playerrights = 3) { sendMessage("You can wear this!"); } else { deleteItem(773,getItemSlot(773),1); sendMessage("You can't wear this!"); sendMessage("It crumbles away!"); }

Try that.[/quote]
where do I put the code?

Read full topic
